definition: taste/smell/(fig.) (noun suffix) feel/quality/sense/(TCM) classifier for ingredients of a medicine prescription

sentences.english: His face was drained of color, and he carried a strange, strong-smelling rag in his hand.
sentences.chinese: 他面无血色，手里拿着一块怪味浓重的布头。

sentences.english: I don't like durians especially their strong odd smell.
sentences.chinese: 我不喜欢榴莲，特别是那股浓烈的怪味。

sentences.english: When this material burns, it flings off an odd smell.
sentences.chinese: 这种材料燃烧时，放出一种怪味。

sentences.english: Can you taste anything strange in this milk?
sentences.chinese: 你吃得出这奶里有什么怪味吗？

sentences.english: Helicopters circle overhead and the air has a strange cloying smell.
sentences.chinese: 直升飞机在上空盘旋，空气中弥漫着甜得发腻的怪味。

sentences.english: I tasted something nasty in the rice and I spat it out.
sentences.chinese: 我在米饭里吃出了怪味，就把饭吐了出来。

sentences.english: This flower gives off an unusuing smell.
There was a faint smell coming from the kitchen.
sentences.chinese: 有一种怪味从厨房飘出。

sentences.english: A passenger told a flight attendant that she smelled something funny.
sentences.chinese: 一名乘客告诉空服员她闻到怪味。

sentences.english: In hot weather, this plastic cover throws off an uunpleasant odour.
sentences.chinese: 在热天，这塑料套子发出一股怪味。

sentences.english: Can you taste anything strange in this soup?
sentences.chinese: 你尝得出这汤里有什么怪味吗？

definition: to smell/to sniff sth out/to perceive by smelling
